newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombia Congress, in reversal, approves anti-drug law.
newsitem.headline: Colombia Congress, in reversal, approves anti-drug law.

text.p: In an abrupt about-face, Colombia's Congress overwhelmingly approved on Thursday the retroactive seizure of property and assets accumulated by the country's billionaire drug barons over the past 20 years.
The lower house of Congress, which rejected the measure just 48 hours earlier, passed it by a huge 103-4 majority.
The surprise vote in the House of Representatives followed the bill's unanimous approval in the Senate earlier Thursday.

The Senate had already approved the bill last week, but a new vote was scheduled on Thursday by a legislative committee that overturned the lower house's rejection of the 20-year time limit on so-called asset forfeiture Tuesday night.

The House had rejected the time limit by 59-57, ruling instead that property linked to convicted drug lords should only be liable to forfeiture if it was accumulated in the aftermath of Colombia's 1991 constitution.

Government officials led by President Ernesto Samper rejected the House vote as a national disgrace, saying it was tantamount to legalizing all ill-gotten gains acquired since Colombia's booming trade in narcotics began in earnest in the late 1970s.
